summary:
I am a Process Engineer with 17 Year of Experience. Worked either as an Area Lead Engineer on a
project or reporting to the Lead Engineer typically on larger projects. 
• Responsible to execute process engineering design for FEED, detailed design, or
EPC projects.
• The major project completed for client Shell is RedIIGreen Biofuels; Shell Lotus (Methyl Ethyl Glycol
plant), Shell Circular Plastic / PVC; Shell Alpha oleﬁns and VITO oﬀshore Plant. 
• For the imperial Oil and Canadian Natural resources client, the major project completed is SAGD
(Steam assisted gravity drainage system ) for Sand Oil Project to separate Bitumen at Alberta location
Canada.

projects.title: Project -. REDIIGreen biofuels facility for Shell globally, at Pernis in the Netherlands
projects.description:
The project involves delivering three renewable fuel products, renewable diesel, Jet, and bio Naphtha. The design feedstock for this Unit is Soyabean Oil, tallow oil, and used cooking oil.
Responsibilities
	To work as an area lead to lead team of Utility for RIIG Project. 
	Responsible to assign the task to the team members based on the deliverable priority and create task code in the scrum board (AZURE Dev ops) and move the scrum board as per team progress. 
	Responsible for and Checking to generate Utility Process Flow Diagram, DP/DT diagram, Process Safeguarding Scheme, and Material Selection diagram.
	Responsible and checking for Utility P&ID
	Checking & approval for Cooling Water, Demin water, Nitrogen, and Natural Gas system.
	Checking & approval of Utility Pump calculation.
	Checking & approval Vessel Sizing.
	Reasonable to check Safeguarding Memorandum.
	Review Vendor documents from a Process Point of view.
	Participate in HAZOP and responsible for closing HAZOP closed-out action.
	Participate in MOC HAZOP (Changes after P& id issued for design) and responsible for closing HAZOP closed out the action.
	To participate in the model review meeting (60% and 90%) and be responsible for closing model review tags.
	To participate in the Roller board meeting of P& id (After P& id is issued for Design) and approve the changes from the Client in the Bluebeam.
	Responsible to prepare new MOC (Management change notice) for engineering development within Utility.
	Responsible for checking new P& id as per Management change notice before issuing for IDC (Interdisciplinary check) Cold eye review.
	To participate Joint review session with a client for the P& id for the Management change notice.
	Responsible for checking safety process time calculation for Instrumentation Protective function.
	To coordinate with the Process control team to develop control on the P&id, to close out Process Control HAZOP point and process optimization.

projects.title: Project - Shell Circular Plastic. Location: Bukom, Norco, Moerdijk.
projects.description:
The project involves the Pyrolysis of plastic waste into so-called pyrolysis oil, which can then be (re)utilized to produce new plastic monomers such as ethylene or propylene. The scope involves the production of cleaned pyrolysis oil steam cracker feed. The plant will remove contaminants from the pyrolysis oil material thereby reducing the contaminants to acceptable levels to be fed to the cracker.

Responsibilities
	Responsible to ensure process engineering technical integrity & quality.
	Checking & approval for Licensor documents like PFDs, PIDS & datasheets of process Packages.
	Checking & approval of EPC contractor’s Process calculations, Drawing & Datasheets.
	To develop Pump Hydraulic Calculation and Control Valve Sizing.
	To develop and prepare Pressure relief valve calculation.
	Reasonable to prepare Safeguarding Memorandum.
	Review Vendor documents from a Process Point of view.

projects.title: Project - Shell Lotus (Shell Global Solution). Location: Geismar LA, USA
projects.description:
The process design package was prepared by Shell Global Solutions for a 1200 kta Mono Ethylene Glycol plant for SHELL Chemical Holdings LP (aka the LOTUS project). The plant design is based on Shell OMEGA process technology.

Responsibilities
	Checking of Licensor documents like PFDs, PIDS & datasheets of process Packages.
	Responsible to develop Pump hydraulics, and controlling valve sizing for ISBL area.
	Responsible to develop pressure relief valve calculation, Emergency valve, and Breather Valve Calculation.

projects.title: Aromatic Refinery Complex Project,ONGC Mangalore Petrochemicals Ltd.
projects.description:
Abstract: To Provide Trunkey Effluent treatment plant for treating the effluents coming from aromatics complex unit / off sites.
•	To design the process to treat the effluent water. To prepare mass balance with PFD, unit sizing, P& ID and Process Utility flow diagram.
•	To prepare Battery limit drawing ,basic design package and Performance data etc
•	To prepare Instrumentation and Control philosophy with cause and effect matrix.
•	To prepare Pump Hydraulic, line size and pressure drop calculations.
•	To prepare equipments, Instrumentation process data sheet and review of technical evaluation from Vendor.
•	To prepare utility consumption list, line scheduled and co-ordination with Piping and Mechanical department for review of piping layout (2D,3D and Isometric Dwg) and GA drawing.
•

projects.title: Canadian Natural Resources Ltd. Kirby North Phase-I Alberta, Canada
projects.description:
Abstract: To develop and support detail engineering package for lead office Jacobs Calgary, Canada.
•	To develop PSV orifice sizing calculations for different scenario as per API-520 and API-521.
•	To calculate inlet / outlet line loss calculations, back pressure evaluation, determination of destination stream and assessment of acoustically Induced vibration, flow induced vibration for PSV.
•	Hydraulic Calculation for Pumps including oil treating, deoiling, steam generation and Glycol system using AFT Fathom model.
•	To prepare control valve sizing calculations and IPDS for inline flow meter, on line instrument and off line instruments.
•	Squad check of IDRN and Vendor document review Package

projects.title: Debottlenecking of Hydrocracker Units Shell Scotford Refinery, in Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta Canada.
projects.description:
Abstract: This project is intended to grow Scotford Manufacturing by debottlenecking its Hydrocracker Units (HCU) up to their maximum reactor utilization, resulting in a nominal 20% expansion.
•	Pro-II simulation of Hydrocracker and Gas recovery unit and to check adequacy of existing equipments.
•	RV sizing for Hydrocracker, Fractionators and Hydrogen compressor units.

projects.title: Exxon Mobil  ROP Creep 2015, Europoort Rotterdam.
projects.description:
Abstract: The objective is to improve the capacity throughput of the Oxo-Alcohol Business Unit by improving the energy efficiency of the Oxo-Alcohol production at ROP/RPI.  
•	Involved in Feed book and P& id development.
•	To prepare authority package for pressure defined system.
•	To prepare RV sizing calculation, IPDS, Line list and mechanical datasheets.

projects.title: FEED of Chlro-Alkali Project. Owner: Ras Tanura Integrated Project Saudi Armaco. Joint Venture Dow Chemical Company.
projects.description:
Abstract: To develop Relief stream feed package for Brine production, Chloroalkali and Hydrogen Chloride Conversion Unit
•	To prepare Scenario relief load check list and PSV orifice sizing calculations for different scenario as per API-520 and API-521.
•	To develop hydraulic calculations for PSV inlet and outlet sizing and check criteria as per API-520/521.
•	Scenario Relief load calculations and sizing for Overflow and Vent.
•	ASME-UG140 calculations for pressure containment vessel as per relief stream philosophy.
•	Preparation of Relief stream philosophy and Relief valve datasheet for PSV, Vent and Overflow.

projects.title: Project - Imperial Oil Limited. Location: Fort Mc Murray, Alberta, Canada.
projects.description:
This is to develop hydrocarbon resources at an oil sand lease at Fort Mc Murray, Alberta, using solvent-assisted steam-assisted gravity drainage technology. The Aspen design is a single phase that consists of a central processing facility (CPF) and infrastructure.
Responsibilities
	Delivering PIDS (250 nos.) in AVEVA Software with quality for three revisions within month time schedule.
	Meeting with the client for progress and technical queries two times a week.
	Responsible for training engineers and designers for quality procedures related to PIDS.
	To develop fuel gas hydraulics in HYSYS Software.
	To develop Pressure relief valve calculation, Flare network model.
	To develop hydraulics in AFT Fathom.
	Responsible for all interdepartmental activities and all process-related work

projects.title: Project – Shell AO4 Project. Location: Geismar LA, USA.
projects.description:
Detail Engineering work for Shell Tiger AO4 (Alpha Olefins-325 Kta of Ethylene) Project. Jacobs Houston and Baton Rouge Office are the lead office for ISBL and OSBL respectively.
Responsibilities
	Responsible to prepare Pressure relief valve, Emergency relief valve, and breather valve calculation.
	Responsible for Safeguarding Memorandum.
	To prepare Pump hydraulics calculation.
	To prepare instrument process datasheet, line list, and Vendor data review.
	To check critical isometrics.

projects.title: Project – Shell VITO Offshore Floating Platform. Location: Gulf of Mexico.
projects.description:
Define and Execute the Phase of the floating production system (FPS) that is designed for processing 100ksbpd Oil, 100MMscfd of Gas Lift, and 10ksbpd of Produced Water.
Responsibilities
	Checking of all PID up to IFD stage.
	Compressor station all PSV’s sizing done (Stone Wall Condition).
	Checking of all Instrument &process datasheets.
	To develop closed-loop hydraulics for hot water and cold-water circuit.
	Responsible for the size of the hot water expansion vessel.
	Responsible for safeguarding Memorandum.
	Responsible for Pressure relief valve calculation and Emergency Relief valve calculation.

projects.title: Revamping of HPU Dossier System
projects.description:
Owner: British Petroleum Nerefco (The Netherlands)
Abstract: To Revamping of Hydrogen Processing Unit and to perform PSV calculations as per protecting equipment.
•	To revise the Scenario relief load check list and Philosophy as per improved process.
•	To develop system sketch ,equipment datasheet ,line list and IPDS
•	To perform Orifice sizing calculations and Inlet and outlet pressure drop calculations for PSV for applicable scenarios.

projects.title: SPVC Debottlenecking
projects.description:
Abstract: The objective is to develop a Basic Engineering Package for the debottlenecking of the existing train C at the S-PVC plant of PetroKemya at its site in Al Jubail, Saudi Arabia.
•	Involved in adequacy check of equipments and instruments with respect to new material balance.
•	To prepare demolition scope P& Id and new equipments sizing calculation.
•	To prepare IPDS and equipment list.
•	To prepare RV sizing calculation

projects.title: Shell Circular Plastic. Location: Bukom, Norco, Moerdijk.
projects.description:
The project involves the Pyrolysis of plastic waste into so-called pyrolysis oil, which can then be (re)utilized to produce new plastic monomers such as ethylene or propylene. The scope involves the production of cleaned pyrolysis oil steam cracker feed. The plant will remove contaminants from the pyrolysis oil material thereby reducing the contaminants to acceptable levels to be fed to the cracker.

Responsibilities
	Responsible to ensure process engineering technical integrity & quality.
	Checking & approval for Licensor documents like PFDs, PIDS & datasheets of process Packages.
	Checking & approval of EPC contractor’s Process calculations, Drawing & Datasheets.
	To develop Pump Hydraulic Calculation and Control Valve Sizing.
	To develop and prepare Pressure relief valve calculation.
	Reasonable to prepare Safeguarding Memorandum.
	Review Vendor documents from a Process Point of view.

profile_positions.description:
CURRENT 19/06/2023- Till date WORLEY NEDERLAND BV, The Netherland (The Hauge). 
05/06/2014 – 18/06/2023 WORLEY INDIA, MUMBAI 
10/09/2013 – 04/06/2014 WORLEY NEDERLAND BV, THE NETHERLAND (The Hauge). 
02/11/2011 – 09/09/2013 WORLEY INDIA, MUMBAI
Activities:
• Worked as Lead as well as Process Engineer to Complete Basic and Details Engineering Package for
Reﬁnery Greenﬁeld & brownﬁeld projects like Oil and Gas, Alpha Oleﬁns, Biofuels, Solvent / steam-
assisted gravity drainage technology, Oﬀshore ﬂoating Platform and Utilities.
• Worked on Projects for clients like Shell Nederland Raﬀ./ Chemie b.v,, Shell Global Solutions
International B.V, Shell SIEP Projects and Technology Upstream Major Projects Americas , Shell
Chemical Company, Canadian Natural resources, Imperial Oil and Saudi Aramco.
• Well exposed to standards & code like API (521,520 and 2000) & CGA, Shell DEPs, other international
standards & recommended practices.
• Extensive use of process software like HYSIS, Aspen, Unsim and Flare net.
• Participate in HAZOP and responsible for closing HAZOP closed-out action.
• Participate in 3D model and responsible for closing tags related to process and support other
engineering discipline.
• Responsible for checking of Pressure relief calculation including Supercritical PSV’s, Breather valve and
Emergency relief valve. 
• Preparation of Standard process deliverables such as design basis, H&MB, PFDs, process descriptions,
P&IDs, Pump hydraulics, IPDS, Stream lines deceleration; Safeguarding Memorandum, trip and alarm
list etc and would be comfortable both originating as well as approving these documents.
Responsibilities:
• Executes process deliverables according to a set engineering design criteria and utilizing approved
engineering procedures, practices, codes and standards.
• Takes the initiative to coordinate the design development with other engineering disciplines while
managing workload and meeting schedule due dates.
profile_positions.title: Process Engineer Level II

profile_positions.description:
Involved in Basic and Detail Engineering Package to Provide Trunkey Eﬄuent treatment plant for
treating the eﬄuents coming from aromatics complex unit/oﬀ-sites.
• This includes PFD , P&D development and equipment sizing of Filter Feed Tank;Oil and Chemical
Sludge Sump; Inlet receiving sump; pH Correction Tank; Flash Mixing Tank; Flocculation Tank ; Raw
Eﬄuent Transfer Pump; Filter Feed Pump.
To develop treatment philosophy documents for sludge generated from eﬄuent complex.
• To Review supplier documents for Sequential Batch Reactor and Dissolved Air Flotation Unit
profile_positions.title: Sr .Process Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Design and retroﬁt suggestions for Acetic acid and HCL gas absorption system.
• Detail Engineering for Manganese Sulphate Mfg.Plant.
• Simulation for Gas Absorption system.
• Pump hydraulics, Line Sizing and control narrative.
• Erection and commissioning of Gas Absorption system. 
• Co-ordination with suppliers and inspection of static and rotating equipment's.
profile_positions.title: Process Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
• Scale up the process to full scale and determine where to manufacture the new process.
• Perform an economic analysis of the process and ﬁts the process in the existing plant and
• eliminate bottlenecks to investigate capacity expansion
• Rating of Crystallizer and Dryer operations. To prepare materials and energy balance for the
• complete process.
• Interaction and coordination with client, factory, and sub-contractors for technical and
• commercial requirements.
profile_positions.title: Executive-Projects (Design)

skills: ASPEN HYSYS (CHEMICAL ENGINEERING PROCESS SOFTWARE) Unisim/Hysys ASPEN Flarenet
